title: ISic000559. I.Sicily inscription 000559
body:
1[s]e · vivi · compara[verun]t [sibi]
2[F]l(avia) · Valentina · et · Assyrius
3[C]harito · et · libert(is) · libertab(usque) · pos-
4[t]erisque · eorum · in · fronte · ped(es) · XI
5[i]n · agro · pedes XIII ne · post · ali-
6qu(i) · aut · bendant · aut · donet
7[i]tem · ariola · pertinente · at
8monumentum · pedes · XII · per · X

l.6 reg., orig. bendant | reg., orig. donet | l.7 reg., orig. at

1[.]E·VIVI·COMPARA[.....]T[....]
2[.]L·VALENTINA·ET·ASSYRIUS
3[.]HARITO·ET·LIBERT·LIBERTAB·POS
4[.]ERISQUE·EORUM·IN·FRONTE·PED·XI
5[.]N·AGRO·PEDESXIIINE·POST·ALI
6QU·AUT·BENDANT·AUT·DONET
7[.]TEM·ARIOLA·PERTINENTE·AT
8MONUMENTUM·PEDES·XII·PER·X

l.6 reg., orig. bendant | reg., orig. donet | l.7 reg., orig. at

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text: CIL

English translation

Alex Antoniou

Flavia Valentina and Assyrius Charito purchased this for themselves, their freedmen and freedwomen, and their descendants. 11 feet on the front by 13 feet deep. No one afterwards shall sell nor give, and likewise in the case of the garden plot belonging to the monument, 12 feet by ten

commentary
